intro: Hamelia longipes, commonly known as the coral honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 feet, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a reddish or bronze underside. The plant produces vibrant orange-red tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting hummingbirds and other pollinators. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a versatile choice for gardens. Hamelia longipes is also known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions, enhancing its adaptability in various landscapes.
